intro: Agalinis linarioides, commonly known as the slender false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often hairy. The species is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered an invasive plant in certain regions.
